discourse_list.title: Working Constitution of the Optimism Collective

content.content: The Optimism Collective is a large-scale experiment in decentralized governance. Our Vision is to sustainably fund those public goods that improve upon the well-being of the Collective and beyond. This Working Constitution enshrines governing provisions and principles that, we hope, are calibrated to the ambition of this Vision. It lays the foundation for a fair, democratic model of decentralized governance that’s built to last. _____________ 1.  This is a “Working” Constitution.  It is exceedingly unlikely that a fixed model of governing the Optimism Collective, defined at the outset of this experiment, can appropriately navigate the Collective’s future challenges. The problem space is too large. So we start from humility, beginning with a Working Constitution that is:   A commitment to experimentation. In its lifetime, the Collective will undertake a series of governance experiments. These experiments should help the Collective understand the balance and power dynamics within its ecosystem, and allow the Collective to define itself, evolve, and grow iteratively over time.  A transitory document. The Working Constitution will remain in effect no more than four years from the date of its adoption. After that, authority over governance will be ceded to a permanent Bedrock Constitution (that incorporates the lessons of the Collective’s prior governance experiments).  2.  OP Citizens and OP Holders will equally coexist within the Collective.  The governing structure of the Collective must balance short-term incentives with its long-term Vision. Too often today, simple token-based governance systems deteriorate due to misaligned incentives or excessive consolidation of power. The Optimism Collective will implement structural mechanisms to counteract those shortcomings, beginning with a bicameral governance system that checks and balances the power of OP Holders and OP Citizens. 3.  The Optimism Foundation will be a steward of the Optimism Collective and its early governance model.  The Optimism Foundation is a Cayman Islands organization responsible for guiding the growth and development of the Optimism Collective. Acting through its Board of Directors, the Foundation may:  Facilitate the administration of Collective governance; Allocate treasury assets to fund public goods, incentivize participants in the Optimism ecosystem, or otherwise further its (and the Collective’s) purpose; Amend this Working Constitution; and Take other actions that are conducive to its stewardship role.  The Foundation will undertake all these responsibilities in a manner that is consistent with the mission of the Collective, and with a view towards increasingly decentralizing its role over time. 4. Rights of OP Citizens and OP Holders.  Subject to the founding legal documents of the Optimism Foundation and the procedures outlined in the Collective’s Operating Manual:  Future OP Citizens may:  Allocate Retroactive Public Goods Funding; and Exercise such additional rights as are provided to OP Citizens over time.   OP Holders may:  Remove a director of the Optimism Foundation; and Veto changes to the founding documents of the Optimism Foundation, if those changes would reduce the rights of OP Holders in a material way.    5.  Interpretation.  In interpreting the scope, authority, and meaning of the provisions of this Working Constitution, the following guiding principles apply:   Governance minimization. Minimal governance is at the heart of the Optimism Collective. When multiple proposals achieve a similar outcome, the Collective should prefer the proposal with the least overhead. We strive to boil down governance to its essence and to avoid introducing regulation where freedom can achieve the same result. We believe this is key to creating the fertile soil for permissionless innovation.  Forking. The right to fork and the right to exit are critical to protect individual freedoms. It’s expected and encouraged that if the governance of the Optimism Collective is captured, members of the Collective fork the system and reinstate a new Collective which better serves the people. All of the core software and tooling required to run the Optimism network should be made open source, freely available, and easy to use such that a fork is always a viable alternative.  Anti-plutocracy. Influence in governance must extend beyond financial stake to value humanhood and intelligent life. The centralizing force of plutocratic token governance is a risk to the health and effectiveness of the Collective, and must be balanced with Citizenship.  impact=profit. The primary function of the Collective is to minimize the discrepancy between collective impact and individual profit. We believe this to be the most important target in the pursuit of solving global coordination problems and creating a better future. Our economy is an expression of our collective needs, wants, and ethics. We harm ourselves when we do not adequately, fairly, and consistently reward positive impact.  6. Always.  Stay Optimistic
Proud to be part of the Optimism Collective! Stay Optimistic, WAGMI!
excited to see how it will work in practice!

gm OP friends! can someone explain to me how I can participate in Optimism governance activities? Where is it possible to vote on proposals? ps: the democratic model that has been devised is really original, cool! is very similar to the governance system of cooperatives
This will be the beginning of a new season for Ethereum. I’m glad to be here today

gm!  can someone explain to me how I can participate in Optimism governance activities?  Before Airdrop #1 we’ll post a Discourse thread & docs which describes: how to make proposals, vote on proposals, and commit to being a delegate. Before then the best way to participate is to read the Discourse  Details on the proposals – We’ll be rolling out proposal types slowly over time. After airdrop #1 is released, we will start voting on project incentives and that will be a majority of the governance at first. The OP which is allocated in this way is known as the “Governance Fund”. We’ll release a bunch of details about the Governance Fund shortly! Later on we’ll start seeing new proposals roll out which include protocol upgrades and retroPGF. It’s important that we roll out new proposal types slowly over time so that everything we do end up governing is done so in a thoughtful and effective manor.  ps: the democratic model that has been devised is really original, cool!  Yay!!! Really glad you like it!

karl:  Before Airdrop #1 we’ll post a Discourse thread & docs which describes: how to make proposals, vote on proposals, and commit to being a delegate. The OP which is allocated in this way is known as the “Governance Fund”. We’ll release a bunch of details about the Governance Fund shortly! Later on we’ll start seeing new proposals roll out which include protocol upgrades and retroPGF. It’s important that we roll out new proposal types slowly over time so that everything we do end up governing is done so in a thoughtful and effective manor.   ok all clear! thanks a lot:)

LFG ! What’s the future about the Optimism Foundation ? We have a “Working” Constitution for four year but what about the influence of the Optimism Foundation. Maybe after four years the members of the foundation could become OP Citizens or the Optimism Collective can vote to employ the Optimism Foundation and continue as is. It would incentive the Optimism Foundation to do well and prove it’s utility and not doom the members of the Optimism Collective if they have less right than the foundation. I say that in reference to the Sushiswap drama and also if there is a collective managing a project it must be from A to Z. I understand the time period were we need to build a governance and operation framework but ultimately with just the Optimism Collective we would have a real decentralized network. Lots to be done but the future is optimistic
Great start. Excited to add value to the collective.

Yes. I completely agree. The bias towards the collective health of citizens while securing a sustainable economy is, In many ways, quite similar to cooperative governance…when it works. Curious too if and how to participate going forward in the iterative refinements of the constitution.

Super excited to see where everything will go in the future!! Our blockchain club is very interested

I’m very excited to see what public goods funding can become through collective stewardship and co-operation, and to see the redistributive impact of alternative taxation through MEV auction and retroPGF!

I’m AxlVaz, active member of the DeFiLATAM community. Here is the Spanish (Latin) translation of the “Working Constitution of the Optimism Collective”. From our community we want to translate these important documents into Spanish for the gov to have more reach and participation. Constitución de Trabajo de Optimism Collective Optimism Collective es un experimento a gran escala de gobernanza descentralizada. Nuestra Visión es financiar de manera sostenible aquellos bienes públicos que mejoran el bienestar del Colectivo y más allá. Esta Constitución de Trabajo consagra disposiciones y principios de gobernanza que, esperamos, estén calibrados para la ambición de esta Visión. Sienta las bases para un modelo justo y democrático de gobernanza descentralizada construida para durar.  1. Esta es una Constitución “de trabajo”. Es sumamente improbable que un modelo fijo de gobierno de Optimism Collective, definido al principio de este experimento, pueda navegar apropiadamente por los desafíos futuros del Colectivo. El espacio del problema es demasiado grande. Así que partimos de la humildad, comenzando con una Constitución de Trabajo que es:   Una apuesta por la experimentación. Durante su vida, el Colectivo emprenderá una serie de experimentos de gobernanza. Estos experimentos deberían ayudar al Colectivo a comprender el equilibrio y la dinámica de poder dentro de su ecosistema, y ​​permitir que el Colectivo se defina a sí mismo, evolucione y crezca iterativamente con el tiempo.  Un documento transitorio. La Constitución de Trabajo permanecerá en vigor no más de cuatro años a partir de la fecha de su adopción. Después de eso, la autoridad sobre el gobierno se cederá a una Constitución Bedrock permanente (que incorpora las experiencias de los experimentos de gobernanza anteriores al Colectivo).  2. Dentro del Colectivo convivirán por igual Ciudadanos OP y Holders OP. La estructura de la gobernanza del Colectivo debe equilibrar los incentivos a corto plazo con su Visión a largo plazo. Hoy en día, con demasiada frecuencia, los sistemas de gobernanza simples basados ​​en tokens se deterioran debido a incentivos desalineados o una consolidación excesiva del poder. Optimism Collective implementará mecanismos estructurales para contrarrestar esas deficiencias, comenzando con un sistema de gobierno bicameral. que controla y equilibra el poder de los titulares de OP y los ciudadanos de OP. 3. Optimism Foundation será un administrador de Optimism Collective y su modelo de gobernanza inicial. Optimism Foundation es una organización de las Islas Caimán responsable de guiar el crecimiento y desarrollo de Optimism Collective. actuando a través de su Consejo de Administración la Fundación podrá:  Facilitar la administración del Gobierno Colectivo; Asignar activos de tesorería para financiar bienes públicos, incentivar a los participantes en el ecosistema de Optimismo o promover su propósito (y el del Colectivo); Reformar la presente Constitución de Trabajo; y Adoptar otras medidas que conduzcan a su función de administración.  La Fundación asumirá todas estas responsabilidades de manera coherente con la misión del Colectivo, y con miras a descentralizar cada vez más su papel en el tiempo. 4. Derechos de los Ciudadanos OP y Holders de OP. Sujeto a los documentos legales fundacionales de Optimism Foundation y los procedimientos descritos en el Manual Operativo del Colectivo:  Los futuros Ciudadanos OP pueden:  Asignar fondos retroactivos de bienes públicos; y Ejercer los derechos adicionales que se proporcionan a los ciudadanos OP a lo largo del tiempo.   Los Holders de OP pueden:  Retirar a un director de la Optimism Foundation; y Vetar los cambios a los documentos fundacionales de Optimism Foundation, si esos cambios reducirían los derechos de los titulares de OP de manera material.    5. Interpretación. Al interpretar el alcance, la autoridad y el significado de las disposiciones de esta Constitución vigente, se aplican los siguientes principios rectores:   Minimización de la gobernanza. La gobernanza mínima está en el corazón de Optimism Collective. Cuando varias propuestas logran un resultado similar, el Colectivo debe preferir la propuesta con menos gastos generales. Nos esforzamos por reducir la gobernanza a su esencia y evitar la introducción de regulación donde la libertad puede lograr el mismo resultado. Creemos que esto es clave para crear el suelo fértil para la innovación permissionless.  Fork. El derecho a la bifurcación (fork) y el derecho a la salida son fundamentales para proteger las libertades individuales. Se espera y alienta que si se captura la gobernanza de Optimism Collective, los miembros del Colectivo bifurcan el sistema y restableceran un nuevo Colectivo que sirva mejor a la gente. Todo el software central y las herramientas necesarias para ejecutar la red de Optimism deben ser open source, disponibles gratuitamente y fáciles de usar, de modo que una bifurcación sea siempre una alternativa viable.  Anti Plutocracia. La influencia en la gobernanza debe extenderse más allá de la participación financiera para valorar la humanidad y la vida inteligente. La fuerza centralizadora de la gobernanza de tokens plutocráticos es un riesgo para la salud y la eficacia del Colectivo, y debe equilibrarse con la Ciudadanía.  impacto=beneficio. La función principal del Colectivo es minimizar la discrepancia entre el impacto colectivo y el beneficio individual. Creemos que este es el objetivo más importante en la búsqueda de resolver los problemas de coordinación global y crear un futuro mejor. Nuestra economía es una expresión de nuestras necesidades, deseos y ética colectivos. Nos hacemos daño a nosotros mismos cuando no recompensamos de manera adecuada, justa y consistente el impacto positivo.  6. Siempre. Mantente Optimistic!

OP Holders may:  Veto changes to the founding documents of the Optimism Foundation, if those changes would reduce the rights of OP Holders in a material way.     Hi guys! Can anyone help elaborate more on this? This means that OP Holders can submit a proposal to vote on rights of OP Holders?

I understand that OP holders may reject a proposal from the Optimism Foundation, the current administrator of the Optimism Collective, if it infringes on the rights or reduces the discretion of OP holders.
Hi @wcc! We’ll be publishing an “Operating Manual” this week that includes more details about voting mechanics, proposal submission, and approval process.

Super cool, I am looking forward to helping evolve this incredible project.  After reading the documentation, I have a few questions that I could not find answers to easily: OP token holders can remove a director from the optimism foundation – but how do directors get appointed or voted onto the board? Do you intend to create a mechanism to strip bad actors of citizenship or of voting power? If holders can veto changes due to a material reduction of holder rights (presumably through a vote), who decides whether an action qualifies as material and therefore goes to a vote? Are answers to the above set in stone or will they reveal themselves as we move forward? Thanks!

(I’m sorry for my bad English, I’m a native speaker of another language) This project seemed interesting to me, but getting acquainted with its principles and foundations, I had big doubts about its honesty and viability. In my opinion, this is a very bad declaration that does not declare anything, it is more like wandering in the clouds. Its provisions are more like populist statements without any justification and proper explanations. Principles, statements are not substantiated, even general mechanisms are not defined. It is not clear what the purpose(goal) of the community is. Who are citizens? What is the point of becoming a citizen or member of this community, for what purpose, for what benefits? What are the mutual rights and obligations of citizens, boards, members of the community? How will the community generate social value, benefit, how to make a profit? Much attention is paid to the concept of “management” and its experimental character. What is meant by the term “management”. What is being managed? For what purpose, to achieve what social result? What is the form of this control? What is the difference between the proposed “decentralized” governance and the already existing forms inherent in democratic societies (elections, referendums, etc.) (With digital technologies, both elections and referendums can be held quickly and cheaply. This does not require a new social system) What are the mechanisms to overcome plutocracy? What is the difference from existing in the real world. impact=profit is a great idea that people of different eras have throughout history. How will this principle be achieved, with the help of what actions? How will the contribution of the participants, its value be evaluated? What reasons, circumstances led to the impossibility of its introduction into the real world for thousands of years? How can we avoid these circumstances and overcome them? These are just the first thoughts that came to my mind. I would like to know the views of the board, the community on this matter.
excited to see how it will work in practice!

I wrote my post because I think that the people who founded this project had their own vision on these issues, studied them deeply, have some rationale and I am very interested in listening to them. I am frustrated by superficial, non-detailed explanations and comments I don’t understand blockchain technology very well, and do I understand correctly that optimism is a layer-2 blockchain that wants to scale ethereum and distribute income from it to public goods? And distribution goals should be determined by the community? I do not have ready answers to all questions, but I want to try to study it all and understand It would be interesting to discuss
Thank you, mate, for great questions and sorry they haven’t been answered yet

Hello! Sorry it has taken so long for a response, as you can see things are very busy. I can’t answer all your questions, but I can answer some of them.  Who are citizens?  Citizens are probably going to be members of the sub-communities within Optimism (i.e active community members from dapps deployed on Optimism). It is very important that one Citizen is one human, which is why there is so much discussion about identity solutions.  What are the mutual rights and obligations of citizens, boards, members of the community?  There are a few questions rolled up here, so I am only going to answer about the Citizens. The rights and obligations of Citizens is to distribute funding to public goods. This will include researching nominated projects to make informed decisions, much like the delegates.  What are the mechanisms to overcome plutocracy?  Citizens are not using tokens to vote (which can be bought). Instead each Citizen represents one human, as such rights to Citizenship cannot be bought. This of course does not prevent bribery of the person, but there are structures that can be put in place to minimise this risk and increase the “cost” of accepting bribes.  How will the community generate social value, benefit, how to make a profit?  Again there are a few questions here, but the main point is, what is paying for public goods? The sequencer profits! The sequencer generates a decent amount of profit, which is being allocated to public goods funding. I know I did not answer all of your questions, but we have written lots of information you can read deeper into that will hopefully answer your questions.  Retrospective on our first round of public goods funding Our governance docs about public goods This Medium article about retroPGF This Mirror article about Ethers Phenix

保存乐观 [quote=“system, post:1, topic:55, full:true”] The Optimism Collective is a large-scale experiment in decentralized governance. Our Vision is to sustainably fund those public goods that improve upon the well-being of the Collective and beyond. This Working Constitution enshrines governing provisions and principles that, we hope, are calibrated to the ambition of this Vision. It lays the foundation for a fair, democratic model of decentralized governance that’s built to last. _____________ 1.  This is a “Working” Constitution.  It is exceedingly unlikely that a fixed model of governing the Optimism Collective, defined at the outset of this experiment, can appropriately navigate the Collective’s future challenges. The problem space is too large. So we start from humility, beginning with a Working Constitution that is:   A commitment to experimentation. In its lifetime, the Collective will undertake a series of governance experiments. These experiments should help the Collective understand the balance and power dynamics within its ecosystem, and allow the Collective to define itself, evolve, and grow iteratively over time.  A transitory document. The Working Constitution will remain in effect no more than four years from the date of its adoption. After that, authority over governance will be ceded to a permanent Bedrock Constitution (that incorporates the lessons of the Collective’s prior governance experiments).  2.  OP Citizens and OP Holders will equally coexist within the Collective.  The governing structure of the Collective must balance short-term incentives with its long-term Vision. Too often today, simple token-based governance systems deteriorate due to misaligned incentives or excessive consolidation of power. The Optimism Collective will implement structural mechanisms to counteract those shortcomings, beginning with a bicameral governance system that checks and balances the power of OP Holders and OP Citizens. 3.  The Optimism Foundation will be a steward of the Optimism Collective and its early governance model.  The Optimism Foundation is a Cayman Islands organization responsible for guiding the growth and development of the Optimism Collective. Acting through its Board of Directors, the Foundation may:  Facilitate the administration of Collective governance; Allocate treasury assets to fund public goods, incentivize participants in the Optimism ecosystem, or otherwise further its (and the Collective’s) purpose; Amend this Working Constitution; and Take other actions that are conducive to its stewardship role.  The Foundation will undertake all these responsibilities in a manner that is consistent with the mission of the Collective, and with a view towards increasingly decentralizing its role over time. 4. Rights of OP Citizens and OP Holders.  Subject to the founding legal documents of the Optimism Foundation and the procedures outlined in the Collective’s Operating Manual:  Future OP Citizens may:  Allocate Retroactive Public Goods Funding; and Exercise such additional rights as are provided to OP Citizens over time.   OP Holders may:  Remove a director of the Optimism Foundation; and Veto changes to the founding documents of the Optimism Foundation, if those changes would reduce the rights of OP Holders in a material way.    5.  Interpretation.  In interpreting the scope, authority, and meaning of the provisions of this Working Constitution, the following guiding principles apply:   Governance minimization. Minimal governance is at the heart of the Optimism Collective. When multiple proposals achieve a similar outcome, the Collective should prefer the proposal with the least overhead. We strive to boil down governance to its essence and to avoid introducing regulation where freedom can achieve the same result. We believe this is key to creating the fertile soil for permissionless innovation.  Forking. The right to fork and the right to exit are critical to protect individual freedoms. It’s expected and encouraged that if the governance of the Optimism Collective is captured, members of the Collective fork the system and reinstate a new Collective which better serves the people. All of the core software and tooling required to run the Optimism network should be made open source, freely available, and easy to use such that a fork is always a viable alternative.  Anti-plutocracy. Influence in governance must extend beyond financial stake to value humanhood and intelligent life. The centralizing force of plutocratic token governance is a risk to the health and effectiveness of the Collective, and must be balanced with Citizenship.  impact=profit. The primary function of the Collective is to minimize the discrepancy between collective impact and individual profit. We believe this to be the most important target in the pursuit of solving global coordination problems and creating a better future. Our economy is an expression of our collective needs, wants, and ethics. We harm ourselves when we do not adequately, fairly, and consistently reward positive impact.  6. Always.  Stay Optimistic  [/quote]

Hi all, Please let me know if this was already discussed:     system:  4. Rights of OP Citizens and OP Holders. Subject to the founding legal documents of the Optimism Foundation and the procedures outlined in the Collective’s Operating Manual:  Future OP Citizens may:  Allocate Retroactive Public Goods Funding; and Exercise such additional rights as are provided to OP Citizens over time.   OP Holders may:  Remove a director of the Optimism Foundation; and Veto changes to the founding documents of the Optimism Foundation, if those changes would reduce the rights of OP Holders in a material way.      According to the aforementioned section, OP Holders are enabled to remove directors and veto changes to the documents of the Optimism Foundation. Despite of having that right, I understand that we are not allowed to review those documents. To that end, we should be given access to, at least:  Optimism Foundation Register of Directors. Optimism Foundation Memorandum. Optimism Foundation Articles of Association.  The foundation was incorporated in the Cayman Islands, and therefore, only Directors/Officers are allowed access to the aforementioned documents. It would be awesome to be able to access such documents in order to exercise the rights listed in section 4.

Besides that, and besides the fact that the Governance will keep being changed until a “Bedrock Constitution” is enacted (This Governance Will Self Destruct — The Optimism Collective), we currently have the Token House as the only Gov House. Hence the importance of getting access to the aforementioned documents in the meantime.

The Optimism Foundation will be a steward of the Optimism Collective and its early governance model.  The Optimism Foundation is a Cayman Islands organization responsible for guiding the growth and development of the Optimism Collective. Acting through its Board of Directors, the Foundation may:  Facilitate the administration of Collective governance; Allocate treasury assets to fund public goods, incentivize participants in the Optimism ecosystem, or otherwise further its (and the Collective’s) purpose; Amend this Working Constitution; and Take other actions that are conducive to its stewardship role.  The Foundation will undertake all these responsibilities in a manner that is consistent with the mission of the Collective, and with a view towards increasingly decentralizing its role over time. 4. Rights of OP Citizens and OP Holders.  Subject to the founding legal documents of the Optimism Foundation and the procedures outlined in the Collective’s Operating Manual:  Future OP Citizens may:  Allocate Retroactive Public Goods Funding; and Exercise such additional rights as are provided to OP Citizens over time.   OP Holders may:  Remove a director of the Optimism Foundation; and Veto changes to the founding documents of the Optimism Foundation, if those changes would reduce the rights of OP Holders in a material way.    5.  Interpretation.  In interpreting the scope, authority, and meaning of the provisions of this Working Constitution, the following guiding principles apply:   Governance minimization. Minimal governance is at the heart of the Optimism Collective. When multiple proposals achieve a similar outcome, the Collective should prefer the proposal with the least overhead. We strive to boil down governance to its essence and to avoid introducing regulation where freedom can achieve the same result. We believe this is key to creating the fertile soil for permissionless innovation.  Forking. The right to fork and the right to exit are critical to protect individual freedoms. It’s expected and encouraged that if the governance of the Optimism Collective is captured, members of the Collective fork the system and reinstate a new Collective which better serves the people. All of the core software and tooling required to run the Optimism network should be made open source, freely available, and easy to use such that a fork is always a viable alternative.  Anti-plutocracy. Influence in governance must extend beyond financial stake to value humanhood and intelligent life. The centralizing force of plutocratic token governance is a risk to the health and effectiveness of the Collective, and must be balanced with Citizenship.  impact=profit. The primary function of the Collective is to minimize the discrepancy between collective impact and individual profit. We believe this to be the most important target in the pursuit of solving global coordination problems and creating a better future. Our economy is an expression of our collective needs, wants, and ethics. We harm ourselves when we do not adequately, fairly, and consistently reward positive impact.  6. Always. Summary: The Optimism Collective is an experiment in decentralized governance that aims to fund public goods that improve well-being. Its Working Constitution is a transitory document that will be in effect for no more than 4 years and sets the foundation for a fair and democratic decentralized governance model. OP citizens and OP Holders will coexist in the Collective, and the Optimism Foundation will act as its steward. The Foundation may allocate treasury assets, amend the Working Constitution, and perform other actions to further its mission. OP citizens have the right to allocate funding and exercise additional rights, while OP Holders have the right to remove a director and veto changes that reduce their rights. The Collective is guided by principles of governance minimization, the right to fork, anti-plutocracy, and impact=profit.
